full_summary:
**Stage 1 - Highway 431 Renovation: Tender Announcement**
=============================================

**Official Languages:** English and French

**Tender Reference Number:** CB-5193-77891193

**Tender Title:** Stage 1 – Highway 431 Renovation, Gros Morne National Park, Newfoundland and Labrador

### Introduction

Parks Canada invites all qualified contractors to participate in a two-stage selection process for the Highway 431 Renovation Project, located in Gros Morne National Park, Newfoundland and Labrador. The project involves the renovation of approximately 12.4 kilometers of roadway along Highway 431, including the reconstruction of the access and parking lot at the Tablelands Trailhead.

**Overview**

* **Project Value:** Estimated at over $5,000,000, plus taxes
* **Project Scope:** Renovation of Highway 431, including ditching, channel excavation, culvert replacements, guide rail replacement, asphalt resurfacing, and parking lot redevelopment
* **Recycled Asphalt:** 15-20% of recycled asphalt to be used in the lower lift along Highway 431
* **Delivery Date:** Project must be completed by November 30, 2023

### Required Qualifications

* Prime General Contractor with heavy civil construction experience
* Ability to perform renovation work along Highway 431 and reconstruct the access and parking lot at the Tablelands Trailhead

### Tender Evaluation Process

* Stage 1: Evaluation of contractor qualifications
* Stage 2: Invitation to Tender (ITT) for financial evaluation based on project specifications and drawings

### Required Documents

* Tender documents available on the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website at www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities
* Addenda, when issued, will also be available on the GETS website

### Enquiries and Contact

All questions and enquiries regarding this tender must be submitted in writing and received at least five business days prior to the tender closing date. Enquiries can be sent to [Christine.piche@pc.gc.ca](mailto:Christine.piche@pc.gc.ca) or by phone at (873) 355-8841.

Note: Late submissions will not be considered. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language. Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both languages, but please notify them if any discrepancies are found.
